title: German Christmas market attack suspect is self-described Saudi dissident
description: The suspect Taleb al-Abdulmohsen, a 50-year-old doctor from Saudi Arabia, had expressed anti-Islam views and described himself as a Saudi dissident, an official said.
author: Victoria Bisset, Kelsey Ables, Souad Mekhennet, Bryan Pietsch
byline: Victoria Bisset, Kelsey Ables, Souad Mekhennet, Bryan Pietsch
excerpt: The suspect Taleb al-Abdulmohsen, a 50-year-old doctor from Saudi Arabia, had expressed anti-Islam views and described himself as a Saudi dissident, an official said.
text: The suspect in the deadly attack on a Christmas market in Germany is a physician and self-described Saudi dissident who has expressed anti-Islamic views, authorities said, and appears to have supported a far-right, anti-immigrant party.At least five people were killed and more than 200 wounded Friday night when a car plowed into a crowd in the central German city of Magdeburg, about 80 miles west of Berlin. A 9-year-old child was among the dead, investigators told reporters Saturday.
html:
The suspect in the deadly attack on a Christmas market in Germany is a physician and self-described Saudi dissident who has expressed anti-Islamic views, authorities said, and appears to have supported a far-right, anti-immigrant party.

At least five people were killed and more than 200 wounded Friday night when a car plowed into a crowd in the central German city of Magdeburg, about 80 miles west of Berlin. A 9-year-old child was among the dead, investigators told reporters Saturday.
